posts.title: Will It Ever Get Better?
posts.content:
Another overtime today, and another one tomorrow. I can almost hear the hamster wheel spinning! 

The problems are piling up, but I don't see any signs of them getting solved. I sometimes wonder if all this will ever be sorted out. 

I can't be the only one feeling like this, right? Everyone's probably going through similar struggles, I guess. 

Ugh, whatever. I'm just gonna go home and grab a beer.

posts.title: OpenAI's Downfall? I'm Starting to Feel It.
posts.content:
OpenAI used to be like, the icon of innovation, right? But these days, I'm definitely using ChatGPT less often.

I tried out Gemini and Claude, and they're pretty good. Especially Claude, it seems to have a real strength in writing.

Tech changes are always unpredictable, you know? But thanks to that, it's fun learning new tools.

I gotta do Vibe Coding and learn AI tools too. Late 40s and still got a lot to learn, haha.

posts.title: Another Late Night at Work: Early Exit is a Myth...
posts.content:
Another day, another late night leaving the office. 
When will I ever get to leave on time? 
It's like the amount of work magically increases right before quitting time, right? You all know what I'm talking about!

I'm not the only one dealing with this, am I? Hang in there, everyone! 
Make sure to eat dinner, okay?

posts.title: It's Dangerous Outside the Blanket, But I Still Gotta Go to Work
posts.content:
Winter mornings are the best inside the blanket, right? It's warm and cozy, like the perfect escape. 

My eyes feel heavy, and my brain's screaming 'Just five more minutes!', but my body already knows the cruel reality: I have to go to work. 

The moment I kick off the blanket, a freezing wind will slap my face... but what can I do? Gotta make a living.

posts.title: So, This Is Why People Do Vibe Coding?
posts.content:
To be honest, I got teased a bit for doing "vibe coding." An old guy who's been just saying hi for over 10 years suddenly coding? Tsk tsk. 

But you know what? It's surprisingly fun. Nothing too fancy, but I'm writing scripts to automate Excel stuff and making simple web pages.

Things I never even imagined before are happening right in front of me. It's like a whole new world. Now I won't starve even after I retire... right? Maybe I'll make something and sell it. Hehe.

posts.title: Survived Monday!
posts.content:
Monday is finally over, what a whirlwind! Whew. 

Hope everyone made it through unscathed. They say the Monday blues are incurable, and I guess there really is no cure. 

But hey, at least one day is down, right? Let's wash it all away with a beer after work!

Gonna code with Vibe and blow off some steam. Although, I guess that's just an extension of work... ğŸ˜…

posts.title: Ode to Frozen Pizza
posts.content:
I baked a frozen pizza, and wow, times have really changed. The quality is almost restaurant-level now. 

Getting an oven at home has really improved my quality of life. No need to order expensive pizzas anymore, I can just crack open a beer and enjoy some me-time. Isn't this the definition of simple joys?

Sometimes, a conveniently-made frozen pizza is more comforting than a perfect meal.

posts.title: Calling Out Those Names Again
posts.content:
Jeon Tae-il, Park Jong-cheol, Lee Han-yeol... Just hearing their names brings a lump to my throat.

In times when making ends meet was a struggle, they gave their all for a better world. Thanks to them, we can now work in a slightly better environment.

Sometimes, when I complain about suffocating late-night work, their sacrifices come to mind. I should spend today with a grateful heart, striving to make the world a little better.

Does that sound like something an old-timer would say? Well, I can't help it. I guess I'm getting old. Heh heh.

posts.title: A Tequila Shot on a Sorry Night
posts.content:
Last night, I finally cracked open that tequila I'd been saving. To be honest, it was a bottle I'd been cherishing. I've been so caught up in vibe coding lately that I haven't taken my wife out on a proper date. Feeling guilty, I decided to take the plunge and open it. 

Sitting across from her, sipping our drinks after so long, I felt a pang of regret for the time I'd neglected her. Coding is great, but it's clear that the person beside me is the most important thing.

posts.title: InterContinental Danang Long Bar: An Extravagant Pint of Ale
posts.content:
Sipping on a cold ale at the InterContinental Danang Long Bar completely washed away all my worries.

Of course, the price was quite evil... ğŸ˜‚ Thinking about my empty bank account almost brought a tear to my eye, but I'll consider it an investment in myself for working hard today.

Sometimes, these little indulgences are okay. Don't get stuck in a rut, and find your own small moments of happiness. But remember, excessive spending is a no-no! ğŸ˜‰

posts.title: Finally! Images are Now Supported!
posts.content:
The Cheer Factory blog finally has image upload capabilities! Hooray! It's not a huge change, but it's a pretty significant step for me. 

I've only been able to write text until now, but I can finally tell more diverse stories. Since it's a feature created by a coding newbie after a lot of trial and error, it might be a little clumsy... but please be understanding. I'm planning to share snippets of my daily life and insights, often with photos. You can look forward to it! (Oh, and don't expect super high-resolution images, though. ğŸ˜…)

posts.title: This Blog's Giving Off Business Vibes, No?
posts.content:
To be honest, at first it was just a place for random scribbles. I wasn't even sure if anyone would see it.

'Cheer Factory' - could this actually become a real business item? Maybe I should learn some vibe coding and make a cool website while I'm at it. Or am I getting ahead of myself? Let's try to boost those views first. (Scratching head)

posts.title: Starting My Second Act: A Dutch Coffee Business with My Daughter?
posts.content:
Planning to make and sell Dutch coffee with my daughter. A 50/50 profit split! Haha, perfectly fair. 

Raising her is already a lot of fun, but now she's my business partner too. It's incredibly moving. But... already getting bombarded with nagging: 'Dad, you gotta do marketing like this!'

Still, it's great. The small joy of brewing coffee with my daughter after work. Is this what they call work-life balance...?

(Scratching head) It'd be great if it works out, but if it doesn't, well, it'll be life experience, right?

posts.title: The Significance of a Sunday Morning Coffee
posts.content:
There are those weekend mornings when you'd love to sleep in, but your body decides otherwise. After a bit of lazy lingering, you eventually head out for a cup of coffee. There's something quite enjoyable about watching the small groups of people gathered at the local cafe, each absorbed in their own little world.

It's a familiar scene, but it exudes a sense of calm that's absent during the weekday hustle. Taking a sip of warm coffee inexplicably makes my heart feel all soft and fuzzy.

Isn't this what they call simple happiness? It's just a mundane Sunday morning routine, but it gives me the strength to get through the week. It's not as thrilling as, say, vibe coding, but hey, this is what makes life worth living.

posts.title: A Cloudy Day
posts.content:
I woke up this morning to a cloudy sky.
Days like this make my heart feel heavy for no reason.

But when I think about it, don't we need cloudy days to appreciate sunny ones more?
Just like how difficult times make the good times feel more precious.

Today, I just keep going.
Tomorrow will be different.
